intro: Euploca aurea, commonly known as the golden euploca, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in wetland environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euploca aurea is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
